info.description:
AHOI (working title) is our managed and flexible banking API designed to offer easy access to your users bank accounts.

[AHOI cookbook](/ahoi/docs/cookbook/index.html)

[Imprint](https://symbioticon.de/legal-notices/)

[Privacy Disclaimer](https://symbioticon.de/data-protection-guidelines/)

© 2016 Starfinanz - Ein Unternehmen der Finanz Informatik
info.title: AHOI API

tags.name: Access
tags.description:
An access represents the connection between a provider and an account. It enables AHOI to log into a (bank) account on behalf of a user.

  Setting up an access is relatively simple: A provider id is required, and the credential fields, which are used to access the provider, have to be set. The latter differ among the various providers. For example, for banks, it is common to use the account number and a secret pin. Other providers might use an e-mail address and a password.

  In a production environment, the pin has to be encrypted.

  Creating an access also allows AHOI to start interacting with the provider: It starts creating accounts, gathering transactions and classifying them. Deleting an access, on the other hand, also removes all associated information.

  Furthermore, an access contains important information about its current state — for example, whether the account has been locked.

tags.name: Account
tags.description:
An account groups financial records (e.g., a bank account). In the case of a bank account, the account has an owner, bank identification number, account number and a balance. For an account to exist, an access first has to be created. Then, an account resource can be queried for transactions, transaction patterns and summaries. Also, it is possible to transfer money from one account to another.

  AHOI allows you to give (user-defined) names to accounts to make them easily recognizable for end users. AHOIs automatic refresh of transactions and balances can also be toggled.

  Notifications define rules related to accounts that trigger events. If set up, these events can be used to send push notifications.

tags.name: Forecast
tags.description: The forecast resource provides a balance forecast for the end of the current month based on the current balance and the transaction patterns that are expected to occur up to the end of the current month. Those transaction patterns are also provided. The current month is determined by the latest `bookingDate` of transactions.

tags.name: Notification
tags.description:
Notifications express the user's interest in certain status updates and changes to the account. It defines rules for an account to trigger an event. If that event occurs, a notification is sent to the associated notification target (e.g., a push notification is sent). In order to work, a notification target has to be set up.

Please note that only one notification type can be created per target and account.

tags.name: Notification target
tags.description: Notification targets are required to send notifications. A notification target represents something that receives notifications (e.g., a push token for sending push notifications to a mobile app).

tags.name: Provider
tags.description: Providers represent financial institutions such as banks. They provide information such as the name of the provider and which institutions AHOI is able to access. A provider is the starting point to set up an access to a provider, to create accounts and to receive transactions.

tags.name: TAN schemes
tags.description: TAN schemes are the available methods for authorizing a transfer.

tags.name: Transaction
tags.description:
A transaction represents a financial operation related to an account. A bank account transaction holds information about the debtor and the creditor, the amount, information about the date and time of booking, its availability and its purpose (as found in the memo field).

  Additionally, a transaction may be related to a recurring transaction pattern.

  The length of the transaction list depends on the provider and the amount of time in which the account has already been set up within AHOI. The provided information may differ from provider to provider.

tags.name: Transaction pattern
tags.description:
Transaction patterns are the results of regularly recurring transactions. These patterns can be automatically recognized by AHOI. The recognition process starts after every account refresh and updates the previously discovered patterns.

  Since the process is not 100% accurate, single transaction patterns can be deactivated or can be created manually by the user.

  Transaction patterns are used to identify upcoming transactions and to calculate a balance forecast. They can be configured to be monthly, quarterly, semi-annually or annually recurring.

  To automatically create a transaction pattern, there has to be at least three transactions related to this pattern.

  One transaction pattern refers to many transactions and one account.

tags.name: Transaction summary
tags.description: This resource returns a list of monthly summaries for an account for each month in which transactions are available. It contains balances and the total sum of incoming and outgoing transactions.

get.description: Returns all registered accesses for the authenticated user. Confidential information like the PIN will not be returned.

post.description:
Create a new access and setup all associated accounts and transactions. This will also trigger the creation of monthly transaction summaries, the analysis of all accounts for recurring transactions, and the calculation of the balance forecast.

 If the credentials were invalid, the validation state is set accordingly. 

 It is possible to have multiple accesses for one user.

parameters.name: accessDto
parameters.description:
A valid BankAccess object containing the required
            **accessFields** as indicated by the provider object and the
            **providerId**.

400.description: Bad Request - List<MessageDto> details on this error

502.description: Bad Gateway - Communication with provider failed

get.description: Retrieve the access with **accessId**. The retrieved object does not contain sensitive information such as the PIN.

parameters.name: accessId
parameters.description: The **id** for the access to retrieve.

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

put.description:
Update the access credentials in **accessFields**. If the access does not exist, the **accessId** does not match the **id** in **accessDto** or the **providerId** is not the same, the status code 404 is returned. If another access with the same login
 data already exists, the status code 409 is returned.
 The updated access is validated by setting up an account. The status code 200 does not imply that the credentials are correct. To check this the client should obtain access.

parameters.name: accessId
parameters.description: The **id** for the access to update.

parameters.name: accessDto
parameters.description:
The Access object that contains the changed credentials in
            **accessFields**. Other fields cannot be edited.

400.description: Bad Request - List<MessageDto> details on this error

delete.description: Delete access with **accessId** and all related accounts. This also deletes related notifications. If this is a user's last remaining access, all notification targets will also be deleted.

parameters.name: accessId
parameters.description: The **id** for the access to delete

400.description: Bad Request - List<MessageDto> details on this error

get.description: Retrieve all accounts for the current user under the **accessId**.

parameters.name: accessId
parameters.description: The **id** for the access for which to retrieve all accounts

get.description: Retrieves all available TAN schemes for access.

parameters.name: accessId
parameters.description: The **id** for the access for which to retrieve the TAN list

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description:
Optional — refreshes the TAN scheme list. If not provided, it
            defaults to `false`.

get.description: Retrieve all accounts for the current user.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **id** for the account to retrieve

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **id** for the account to delete

put.description: After creating an access, you need to enable automatic refresh if you wish to continuously update your account data and receive configured notifications.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **id** for which to set the automatic refresh

parameters.name: automatic
parameters.description: `true` if the automatic refresh should be activated, otherwise `false`

get.description:
The current month is determined by latest `bookingDate` of transactions.
 The request also retrieves the transaction patterns expected to be applied until the end of the current month.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for which to retrieve forecasts

400.description:
Bad Request - forecast not available for current month, update
       turnovers first

get.description: Returns all transaction pattern for **accountId**. Transaction patterns are recurring transactions automatically identified by the server or manually created via [create transaction pattern](#!/Transaction_pattern/postTransactionPattern).

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for which to retrieve transaction patterns

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

post.description:
Create a new pattern for an **accountId**. The **cycle** can be one of `MONTHLY`, `QUARTERLY`, `SEMI_ANNUALLY` or `ANNUALLY`. The **day** can be between `1` and `366`, depending on **cycle**:

| cycle | day range | example |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `MONTHLY` | `1`-`31`  | every 29th of the month => `29` |
| `QUARTERLY` | `1`-`92`  | 23rd of February (23rd of May, etc.) => `54` (31 [complete first month] + 23 [days in second month]) |
| `SEMI_ANNUALLY` | `1`-`184` | 1st of May and 1st of November => `121` (for first half of year: 31 + 28 + 31 + 30 + 1) |
| `ANNUALLY` | `1`-`366` | 24th of December => `358` |

If a similar pattern already exists, you will receive an HTTP status code 409.

parameters.name: transactionPatternDto
parameters.description: The transaction pattern to create

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** to which the new created pattern is associated with

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

get.description:
Returns the transaction pattern identified by **patternId** in relationship with
 **accountId**.

parameters.name: patternId
parameters.description: The **patternId** for the pattern to retrieve

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accoundId** for the pattern to retrieve

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

delete.description: Delete the transaction pattern identified by the **patternId**. All associated transactions will be updated to {{patternId = null}}.

parameters.name: patternId
parameters.description: The **patternId** to delete

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for the transaction pattern to delete

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

put.description: Disabling the transaction pattern results in ignoring the pattern in the forecast. The transaction still exists and relations with transactions are not modified.

parameters.name: patternId
parameters.description: The **patternId** to (de)activate

parameters.name: activated
parameters.description:
If `true`, the pattern will be used for forecast calculations;
        `false` will be ignored

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for which to activate the pattern

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

parameters.name: patternId
parameters.description: The **patternId** for which to retrieve transactions

parameters.name: max-age
parameters.description: Optional — indicates the maximum acceptable timeframe (in seconds) since the last refresh of the given account

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional — limit the number of returned transactions

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Optional — skip the first ${offset} transactions in result

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Optional — only return transactions with a booking date later than ${from}; an ISO8601 Month(2014-11), Date (2014-11-17) or DateTime
        (2014-11-17T12:00:00Z)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Optional — only return transactions with a booking date prior or equal to ${to}; an ISO8601 Date, Month or DateTime

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for which to retrieve transactions

233.description:
Success - but content was not refreshed (provider is
       blacklisted/COM protocol is not supported)

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

203.description:
Success - but content was not refreshed (perhaps no access with
       ValidationState=OK)

parameters.name: max-age
parameters.description: Optional — indicates the maximum acceptable timeframe (in seconds) since the last refresh of the given account.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional — limit the number of returned transactions

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Optional — skip the first ${offset} transactions in result

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Optional — only return transactions with booking date later than ${from}; an ISO8601 Month(2014-11), Date (2014-11-17) or DateTime
        (2014-11-17T12:00:00Z)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Optional — only return transactions with booking date prior or equal to ${to}; an ISO8601 Date, Month or DateTime

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for which to retrieve transactions.

233.description:
Success - but content was not refreshed (provider is
       blacklisted/COM protocol is not supported)

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

203.description:
Success - but content was not refreshed (perhaps no access with
       ValidationState=OK)

get.description: Returns the transaction identified by **transactionId** in relationship with **accountId**.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The **transactionId** for the pattern to retrieve

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for the transaction to retrieve

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

get.description: Retrieve account summaries and provide a sum for incoming and outgoing transactions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional — limit the number of returned summary entries

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Optional — skip the first ${offset} summary entries in the result

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Optional — only return summary entries later than ${from}; an
        ISO8601 Date (2014-11-17)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
Optional — only return summary entries prior or equal to
        ${to}; an ISO8601 Date

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for which to list the summaries

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

post.description:
The transfer represents a money
 transfer from the account identified by its ID to another bank account.

 **Please note:** Exception from the norm. This POST request will not return
 the two header fields X-Id and Location. Also, the returned JSON document
 does not represent the transfer entity but rather a temporary placeholder.

parameters.name: transfer
parameters.description: The *Transfer* object to initiate a transfer

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **accountId** for the transfer

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

post.description:
**Please note:** Exception from the norm. This POST request will not return
 the two header fields X-Id and Location. The returned JSON document
 represents the transfer.

parameters.name: transferChallengeResponse
parameters.description: The *TransferChallengeResponse* object to authorize the transfer

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **account** for the triggered authorization

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The **taskId** given in the TransferChallenge

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

put.description: Update the account name used in AHOI. Name must be URL encoded.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The **id** for which the user-defined account name should be altered

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new URL-encoded name

get.description: Retrieve all notification targets for the authenticated client.

post.description:
Create a new notification target to receive configured notifications. 
The two current supported systems are the Apple Push Notification service (APNs) for `IOS` devices and Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) for `ANDROID`, which must be supplied in **state**.
The **appToken** must contain the unique identifier you receive after registering your device with the messaging services.
The **locale** must comply to ISO 3166 language code. Currently only `de_DE` is supported.

parameters.name: notificationTargetDto
parameters.description: The notification target to create

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** to retrieve

put.description: Update a notification target. Usually used to change the **appToken** since the messaging services alter those periodically. The **id** in **notificationDto** must match the **targetId**.

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** to update

parameters.name: notificationTargetDto
parameters.description: The notification target with updated token

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

delete.description: Delete a notification target identified by **targetId**. Also deletes associated notifications.

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** to delete

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

204.description: No Content - notification target was deleted

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** for which to retrieve notifications

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** for which to create the notification

parameters.name: notificationDto
parameters.description: The balance change notification to create

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** for which to create the notification

parameters.name: notificationDto
parameters.description: The budget change notification to create

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

post.description:
Receive a notification for your account status on the configured days and at the configured time. Please make sure to pass your timezone or adjust for UTC. 

 This example notifies you every day at 12:03 UTC 

 ```json
{
  "type": "DailySummaryNotification",
  "accountId": 0,
  "daysOfWeek": [
    'MONDAY', 'TUESDAY', 'WEDNESDAY', 
    'THURSDAY', 'FRIDAY', 'SATURDAY', 
    'SUNDAY'
  ],
  "timeOfDay": "12:03Z"
}
```

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** for which to create the notification

parameters.name: notificationDto
parameters.description: The daily summary notification to create

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** for which to create the notification

parameters.name: notificationDto
parameters.description: The new transaction notification to create

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** for which to retrieve the notification

parameters.name: notificationId
parameters.description: The *notificationId* to retrieve

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

put.description: Update the notification identified by **notificationId**. The **notificationId** must match the **id** in **notificationDto**. Please note that type depending restrictions from creating a notification also apply here.

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** for which to create the notification

parameters.name: notificationId
parameters.description: The **notificationId** to update

parameters.name: notificationDto
parameters.description: The notification data to update

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The **targetId** for which to delete the notification

parameters.name: notificationId
parameters.description: The **notificationId** to delete

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

get.description: Retrieve a list of bank providers. A provider-**id** is necessary to create an _access_. To retrieve the necessary access fields, you need to query the specific `provider/{providerId}`. For performance reasons they are kept separate.

parameters.name: bankCode
parameters.description:
Optional — if length = 8, the response will also contain data describing
            the fields required for account setup

parameters.name: supported
parameters.description:
Optional — response should only contain providers supported for account
            setup via this API

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
Optional — search parameters for BankCode, BIC, Location, Name. Will be ignored
            if the bankCode query parameter is set.

403.description: client not allowed to use this service

get.description: Retrieve a single provider identified by **providerId**.

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: The **providerId** to retrieve

400.description: Bad Request - List of MessageDto with details on this error

id.description: Internal ID of this account (generated value)

name.description: Account name returned by bank provider (e.g., "Giro Account")

userDefinedName.description:
Account userDefinedName. This value can be set to define a custom name used in AHOI (e.g., "My Giro Account").
 Can be changed by using the account resource.

owner.description: Account owner returned by bank provider (e.g., "Max Mustermann")

providerId.description: Identifier of the provider to which this account belongs

kind.description:
An account kind is a classification of its structure and its possibilities. 
 This is typically defined by the bank provider.

automaticRefresh.description:
Flag to determine whether this account is automatically refreshed on the server side. 
 Requires that the corresponding access has its PIN saved.
 Can be updated by using the account resource.

 Default is `false`.

type.description: Discriminator for subtypes. At the moment only `BankAccount` is supported.

id.description: Internal ID of this access (generated value)

providerId.description: Identifier of the provider to which this access belongs

accessFields.description:
Authentication data for the given provider as map of InputFieldId to String (e.g., `{"USERNAME", "yourName"}`)
 The fields necessary for the access are determined by the 
 InputField descriptions of the related provider.

validationState.description:
The state reflects the validity of the access credentials. The state can change after communicating with the provider.
 It can be OK (access credentials are valid); `ACCESS_LOCKED` (access is locked: This can happen when, for example, someone tried to login to your account by
 using an incorrect PIN too many times or if your account was used for illegal purposes — automatic refresh will be disabled); or `ACCESS_WRONG` (access wrong: Saved
 credentials are incorrect and no communication with the provider is possible — automatic refresh will be disabled)

type.description: Discriminator for subtypes. At the moment only `BankAccess` is supported.

id.description: Internal ID of this notificationTarget (generated value)

appToken.description: Installation of specific application token to which to send push notifications. (e.g., device token on iOS devices)

productId.description: ID of the application. Has to be set up in AHOI. Use "sandbox-product" in sandbox environment.

locale.description:
Locale used to determine notification titles and texts for this target. 
 Defaults to 'de_DE'.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account to which this notification belongs.

lowerThreshold.description: Optional limitation; lower threshold of the amount (negative values allowed) above which notifications will be sent

upperThreshold.description: Optional limitation; upper threshold of the amount (negative values allowed) below which notifications will be sent

id.description: Internal ID of this notification (generated value)

type.description: Discriminator for subtypes. At the moment `BalanceChangeNotification`, `BudgetNotification`, `DailySummaryNotification` and `NewTransactionNotification` are supported.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account to which this notification belongs

lowerThreshold.description: Optional limitation; lower threshold of the amount (negative values allowed) above which notifications will be sent

upperThreshold.description: Optional limitation; upper threshold of the amount (negative values allowed) below which notifications will be sent

transferTaskId.description: TranferTaskID - The referenced task for that payment — challenge

fieldDescriptions.description: Information to describe and facilitate validation of an transfer.

responseObjects.description: FieldSet — The required InputFields for that challenge

example.challenge: Bitte geben Sie Ihre TAN ein!

USERNAME.description: Should be filled with the username if the Provider object signals this as mandatory.

CUSTOMERNUMBER.description: Should be filled with the customer number if the Provider object signals this as mandatory.

PIN.description: Should be filled with the PIN if the Provider object signals this as mandatory.

transferTaskId.description: TransferTaskID — The referenced task for that payment challenge

responseObjects.description: FieldSet — The required InputFields for that challenge

cleanPurpose.description: Cleaned purpose. Some SEPA information is filtered out (e.g., "KREF+-1434947533-2...")

prebooked.description: Flag to identify if the transaction is marked as pre-booked

id.description: Internal ID of this TanMedia (generated value)

description.description: Description of TANMedia (e.g., phone number or card number used for given type)

id.description: Internal ID of this monthlySummary (generated value)

month.description: The month to which this entry belongs (year-month in ISO-8601: "yyyy-MM")

accountId.description: ID of account to which this entry belongs

income.description: Sum of all incoming transactions for this month

outgoings.description: Sum of all outgoing transactions for this month

value.description: Amount value (in smallest unit; e.g., euro cents)

id.description: Internal ID for this field description

label.description: Label for this field description (e.g., 'PIN', 'Login name', 'Customer No.')

masked.description:
Flag that indicates whether the given field value must be masked when entered on client side or encrypted when persisted
 on the server side

format.description:
Format of field value
 Can be `DEFINITELYNUMERIC` (format is definitely numeric), `DEFINITELYALPHANUMERIC` (format is definitely alphanumeric),
 `PROBABLYALPHANUMERIC` (format is probably alphanumeric; numeric is unlikely but possible), `PROBABLYNUMERIC` (format is probably
 numeric; alphanumeric is unlikely but possible) or `UNSPECIFIED` (default, no hint available)

lengthMin.description: Minimum length of field value (0 = no limit)

lengthMax.description: Maximum length of field value (0 = no limit)

balance.description: Current balance. This value is set whenever the account is refreshed.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account to which this notification belongs

lowerThreshold.description: Optional limitation; lower threshold of the amount (negative values allowed) above which notifications will be sent

upperThreshold.description: Optional limitation; upper threshold of the amount (negative values allowed) below which notifications will be sent

searchKeyword.description: Optional limitation on transactions for given keywords (e.g., owner "Hans Muster" or purpose "Salary")

id.description:
Internal ID of this provider. A constant to identify provider even when,
 for examplr, their bank code changes (provided type is BankProvider)

accessDescription.description: Description of the access for the account setup (e.g., UI input fields)

supported.description: Whether this bank is supported by the AHOI API (i.e., whether you can establish a connection to this provider).

type.description: Discriminator for subtypes. At the moment only `BankProvider` is supported.

accessDescription.infoText: Sofern Ihr Institut Ihnen keine separate Benutzerkennung mitgeteilt hat, geben Sie bitte unter Benutzerkennung Ihre Kontonummer ein. In Abhngigkeit von Ihrem Kreditinstitut knnen zustzliche Informationen, wie beispielsweise eine Kundennummer, hinterlegt werden. Diese Eingabe ist meistens optional.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account to which this notification belongs

timeOfDay.description:
Time of the day when this notification should be triggered. Must be in the desired timezone or normalized to UTC. (ISO-8601; e.g.,
 "13:45.30.123456789+02:00")

daysOfWeek.description:
The days of the week on which these notification should be triggered. All entries must be unique.

Can be `MONDAY`, `TUESDAY`, `WEDNESDAY`, `THURSDAY`, `FRIDAY`, `SATURDAY` or `SUNDAY`

transactionPatternId.description: Identifier of the transactionPattern to which this transaction belongs

id.description: Internal ID of this transaction (generated value)

type.description: Discriminator for subtypes. At the moment only `GiroTransaction` is supported.

infoText.description:
Information text by the provider as a description for required user actions during the account setup (e.g., 
 "Provided your financial institution has not given you a separate username, please enter
 your account number as your username. Depending on your financial institution,
 additional information such as a customer number can be entered. Most of the time
 entering this information is optional.")

fieldDescriptions.description: Information to describe and facilitate validation of an access.

accountId.description: ID of account to which this entry belongs

iban.description: IBAN - International Bank Account Number (defined in ISO 13616-1)

bic.description: BIC - Business Identifier Code (defined in ISO-9362)

tanMediaId.description: TANMediaId - The identifying ID of the TANMedia.

tanScheme.description: TANScheme - The scheme "number" that is used to verify this payment

id.description: Internal ID of this transactionPattern (generated value)

state.description:
State of this pattern
 can be `ACTIVE` (default) or `INACTIVE` (user has disabled it)

cycle.description: Frequency of occurrence for this pattern

origin.description: Origin of creation can be `FINDER` (automatically found) or `MANUAL` (created by user). Cannot be set with creation or update.

day.description: Day in the cycle this pattern occurs

relatedAccountOwner.description: Name of owner of related account (debtor or creditor)

accountNumber.description: Account number or IBAN of related account (debtor or creditor)

bankCode.description: Bank code number or BIC of related account (debtor or creditor)

name.description: Name of the used TAN scheme

tanMediaList.description: List of available TAN media for this scheme
